Here, g◦f denotes function composition x↦→f(x) ↦→g(f(x)).
Example 5.5 (Chain rule)
Let us compute the derivative of the function h(x) = (2x+ 1)4 using the
chain rule. With
h(x) = (2x+ 1)4 = g(f(x)) , (5.33)
f(x) = 2x+ 1, (5.34)
g(f) = f4 , (5.35)
we obtain the derivatives of f and gas
f′(x) = 2 , (5.36)
g′(f) = 4f3 , (5.37)
